message: Estate planning presents the potential for various intrafamilial conflicts that attorneys must be capable of spotting and handling ethically in their practices.

You’re invited to join Leah Del Percio, attorney and founder of Trustate, as she discusses how attorneys can employ strategies to mitigate conflicts in a members-only presentation on Friday, November 3, 2023, at 3:00 p.m. ET./12:00 p.m. PT.
This presentation is approved for one hour of Legal Ethics MCLE credit in California.
*Please note: While all Justia Connect members are invited to attend our free webinars, you must upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to be eligible to earn MCLE credit.
Estate planning presents the potential for various intrafamilial conflicts that attorneys must be capable of spotting and handling ethically in their practices.

Please join Leah Del Percio, attorney and founder of Trustate, as she discusses effective strategies to mitigate conflicts during Estate Planning in a members-only presentation on Friday, November 3, 2023, at 3:00 p.m. ET./12:00 p.m. PT.
This presentation is approved for one hour of Legal Ethics MCLE credit in California.
*Please note: While all Justia Connect members are invited to attend our free webinars, you must upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to be eligible to earn MCLE credit.
Reminder: You are registered for Navigating & Mitigating Ethical Conflicts in Estate Administration & Planning today at 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT.
You can use this link to join us.
If you have trouble, please contact Justia Support for assistance.

*Please note: This presentation is accredited for one hour of General MCLE credit in California. If you want CLE credit, you will need to upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to take advantage of this exclusive benefit.

Thank you for joining us for our recent Justia Webinars presentation! You must complete your attendance verification to receive CLE credit. As a reminder, if you have a free Justia Connect membership, you must upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to receive CLE credit.
The steps below must be completed by 12:00 p.m. PT on Sunday, October 29, 2023 to receive credit.
number-list: Input the attendance verification code received during your presentation.
Follow the remaining prompts in the form to input all pertinent information and offer evaluation of the MCLE presentation.
Download your certificate, and you’re done!
message2: If you have any questions about verification, please contact Justia Support.
